text: Zhanna Nemtsova (born 24 March 1984) is a Russian journalist and activist. She is the daughter of Boris Nemtsov, a Russian opposition politician who was killed in 2015. In 2016, she received the International Women of Courage Award. == Work == After Nemtsova's father was killed, Nemtsova moved to Germany. In Germany, she started the Boris Nemtsov Foundation to work for democratic values in Russia. In Germany Nemtsova worked for the German news service Deutsche Welle. She also wrote a book, Waking up Russia (in the original German, Russland wachr√ºtteln) about Russian politics. Nemtsova also wrote for The Guardian. == Other websites == * 2016 International Women of Courage Awards, U.S. State Department photostream on Flickr *Secretary's International Women of Courage Award (U.S. Department of State) == References == Category:1984 births Category:Living people Category:Russian activists Category:Russian journalists Category:Women who received the International Women of Courage Award
title: Zhanna Nemtsova
